name: DragAndDrop

types.name: Action
types.comment: A type for actions performed on draggable items.

types.name: MouseEvent
types.comment: A type for individual events in a drag and drop sequence.

values.name: automaton
values.comment:
An [Automaton](http://package.elm-lang.org/packages/evancz/automaton/latest)
that can be used in specific situations where [`track`](#track)/[`trackMany`](#trackMany) are
not applicable. See
[Example4.elm](https://github.com/jvoigtlaender/elm-drag-and-drop/blob/master/Example4.elm)
([demo](https://jvoigtlaender.github.io/elm-drag-and-drop/Example4.html)).
The automaton is also used internally in the [`track`](#track) and [`trackMany`](#trackMany)
functions.
values.type: Maybe.Maybe a -> Automaton.Automaton (DragAndDrop.Input a) (Maybe.Maybe ( a, DragAndDrop.Action ))

values.name: mouseEvents
values.comment:
A signal of drag and drop sequence events, fed by `Mouse.isDown`
and `Mouse.position`. A possible history of this signal could be
`StartAt (10,10)`, `MoveFromTo (10,10) (12,10)`, `MoveFromTo (12,10) (13,8)`,
`EndAt (13,8)`, `StartAt (20,15)`, `MoveFromTo (20,15) (22,18)`,
`EndAt (22,18)`, ...

values.name: track
values.comment:
Track a single draggable item. The `Bool` and `Signal Bool`
arguments are the initial value and input signal which tell whether
the mouse is (currently) hovering over the draggable item. An example
use
([Example1.elm](https://github.com/jvoigtlaender/elm-drag-and-drop/blob/master/Example1.elm) -
[demo](https://jvoigtlaender.github.io/elm-drag-and-drop/Example1.html)):

    hover = Signal.mailbox False
    
    box = Graphics.Input.hoverable (Signal.message hover.address)
                                   (putInBox (leftAligned (fromString "drag-and-drop me")))
    
    putInBox e =
      let (sx,sy) = sizeOf e
      in layers [e, collage sx sy [outlined (solid black) (rect (toFloat sx) (toFloat sy))]]
    
    moveBy (dx,dy) (x,y) = (x + toFloat dx, y - toFloat dy)
    
    main =
      let update m =
            case m of
              Just (MoveBy (dx,dy)) -> moveBy (dx,dy)
              _                     -> identity
      in Signal.map (\p -> collage 200 200 [Graphics.Collage.move p (toForm box)])
                    (foldp update (0,0) (track False hover.signal))

values.name: trackMany
values.comment:
Track several draggable items. The `Maybe a` and `Signal (Maybe
a)` arguments are the initial value and input signal which tell
whether the mouse is (currently) hovering over a draggable item, and
over which one. An example use
([Example2.elm](https://github.com/jvoigtlaender/elm-drag-and-drop/blob/master/Example2.elm) -
[demo](https://jvoigtlaender.github.io/elm-drag-and-drop/Example2.html),
also using `putInBox` and `moveBy` from above):

    hover = Signal.mailbox Nothing
    
    box1 = Graphics.Input.hoverable (Signal.message hover.address << \h -> if h then Just 1 else Nothing)
                                    (putInBox (leftAligned (fromString "drag-and-drop me")))
    
    box2 = Graphics.Input.hoverable (Signal.message hover.address << \h -> if h then Just 2 else Nothing)
                                    (putInBox (leftAligned (fromString "and me too")))
    
    main =
      let update m =
            case m of
              Just (1, MoveBy (dx,dy)) -> \(p1,p2) -> (moveBy (dx,dy) p1, p2)
              Just (2, MoveBy (dx,dy)) -> \(p1,p2) -> (p1, moveBy (dx,dy) p2)
              _                        -> identity
      in Signal.map (\(p1,p2) -> collage 200 200 [Graphics.Collage.move p1 (toForm box1),
                                                  Graphics.Collage.move p2 (toForm box2)])
                    (foldp update ((0,15), (0,-15)) (trackMany Nothing hover.signal))

A more dynamic example can be found in
[Example3.elm](https://github.com/jvoigtlaender/elm-drag-and-drop/blob/master/Example3.elm)
([demo](https://jvoigtlaender.github.io/elm-drag-and-drop/Example3.html)).
values.type: Maybe.Maybe a -> Signal.Signal (Maybe.Maybe a) -> Signal.Signal (Maybe.Maybe ( a, DragAndDrop.Action ))
